passage_text: ALKOR Aluminium Profiles. ALKOR Industrietechnik GmbH is a global supplier of interlocking aluminium profiles. As authorised resellers of ALKOR products in sub-Saharan Africa, we can vouch for the superior quality and cutting edge design of the extensive product range.

Extrusion is a process used to create objects of a fixed cross-sectional profile. A material is pushed through a die of the desired cross-section. 1 Aluminium is the most commonly extruded material. 2  Aluminium can be hot or cold extruded. 3  If it is hot extruded it is heated to 575 to 1100 °F (300 to 600 °C). 4  Examples of products include profiles for tracks, frames, rails, mullions, and heat sinks.

Aluminium (or aluminum; see different endings) is a chemical element in the boron group with symbol Al and atomic number 13. It is a silvery-white, soft, nonmagnetic, ductile metal. Aluminium is the third most abundant element (after oxygen and silicon) in the Earth 's crust, and the most abundant metal there. It makes up about 8% by mass of the crust, though it is less common in the mantle below.
